summary: A personal letter from Christine Malina-Maxwell, Ghislaine Maxwell's sister, to Judge Alison J. Nathan, submitted as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application. The letter provides a character reference, family history, and argues for Ghislaine's innocence and suitability for bail, including an offer of a $1.5 million property as collateral.

connections.description: Sisters, described as very close-knit, with a relationship that strengthened in adulthood over shared interests like the TerraMar Project.
Married for 34 years, raised three children together.
Father-daughter relationship. Ghislaine had to rebuild her life after his death in 1991.
Christine is writing a personal appeal to Judge Nathan regarding her sister's bail application.

events.title: Birth of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was born on Christmas Day.

events.title: Car crash injuring Michael Maxwell
events.description: Two days after Ghislaine's birth, the eldest brother Michael was critically injured in a car crash, leading to a 7-year coma and eventual death.

events.title: Death of Robert Maxwell
events.description: The death of Ghislaine's father, after which she had to rebuild her life in New York.

events.title: UN Sustainable Development Goal 14
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's TerraMar Project is credited with influencing the United Nations to enunciate Sustainable Development Goal 14 regarding ocean conservation.

events.title: Christine's visits with Ghislaine
events.description: Christine stayed with Ghislaine on the East Coast for several days in August and for a week in December 2019, witnessing her preparing her defense against media accusations.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest and incarceration
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is incarcerated, facing criminal charges. The letter describes her conditions, including over 150 days of solitary confinement, and is part of a bail application.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Christine Malina-Maxwell offers her only property, valued at $1.5 million, as collateral for her sister Ghislaine Maxwell's bail.
The letter asserts Ghislaine Maxwell's innocence of all criminal charges and claims she has never before been arrested or charged.
Ghislaine Maxwell is described as the founder of the non-profit TerraMar Project, focused on ocean conservation, which influenced a UN Sustainable Development Goal.
The author states that their father, Robert Maxwell, told his children he would leave his entire wealth to science, not to them.
The letter details the severe conditions of Ghislaine Maxwell's incarceration, including over 150 days in solitary confinement, which the author argues hinders her ability to prepare a defense.
